info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 21 at 11:21PM CDT until May 22 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN SMITH...HARRISON...PANOLA...EASTERN RUSK...NORTHERN NACOGDOCHES...WESTERN SHELBY...SOUTHEASTERN WOOD...SOUTHERN UPSHUR AND GREGG COUNTIES... At 1121 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near West Mountain to 7 miles southwest of Marshall to near Tenaha to near Martinsville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. Multiple trees and power lines have been downed across East Texas with these storms. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Longview, Nacogdoches, Marshall, Kilgore, Carthage, White Oak, Gladewater, Center, Hallsville, Tatum, Big Sandy, Hawkins, Tenaha, Timpson, Garrison, Clarksville City, Beckville, East Mountain, Deberry and Elysian Fields. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
